champ.champInfo:
The overall management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the Ministry of Youth and Sports of Ukraine (hereinafter - the Ministry of Youth Sports) together with the NGO "National Kyokushinkai Karate Federation of Ukraine" (hereinafter - the Federation). The direct holding of the competition is entrusted to the Youth and Sports Department of the Lviv Regional State Administration, the Lviv Regional Federation of Kyokushinkai Karate, the Main Board of Judges, approved by the Federation

Organizing committee and judges:

  • The main judge of the competition is a sports judge with kyokushinkai karate of the international category Shikhan Oleksandr Korol, 6th dan (Lviv)
  • Technical support — Ihor Tatarchenko (Lviv)

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until March 18, 2024. Or to the e-mail of the organizing committee:
(hidden) or (hidden)
Contact numbers:
Secretary of NFKKU senpai Yulia Tsekhemstruk: +38(093) 379-17-57, +38(067) 964-90-12
Ihor Tatarchenko: +38(067)-788-77-28

The date and place of the competition

The competition will be held in Lviv, March 23-24, 2024.
Date of arrival – March 23, 2024.
The place of the event is the game hall of the NU "Lviv Polytechnic", address: Lviv, str. Ulas Samchuk, bldg. 14
Competition starts on March 24 at 09:00

Competition program

March 23 (Saturday):

  • 10:00–13:00 meeting of the Presidium of the NFKKU (Lviv Polytechnic University, address: Lviv, Ulasa Samchuk St., bldg.14)
  • 10:00–16:00 team registration, mandate and medical commissions, weighing of participants (Lviv Polytechnic University, address: Lviv, Ulasa Samchuk St., building 14)
  • 15:00–19:00 meeting of the Council of the National Committee of the National Academy of Sciences (Lviv Polytechnic University, address: Lviv, Ulasa Samchuk St., building 14)

March 24 (Sunday):

  • 08:00–08:15 meeting of the technical secretariat of the competition
  • 08:00–08:30 draw of competition participants
  • 08:00–08:30 a.m. meeting of competition judges, formation of judging teams
  • 08:30–09:00 ceremonial opening of the competition (parade of competition participants)
  • 09:00–11:00 competition in the "kata" section
  • 11:00–16:30 competition in the "kumite" section
  • 16:30–17:00 end of competition, awarding of competition winners and prize-winners, closing of competition

Competition participants.

  • Sportsmen, members of national kyokushinkai karate teams of the Republic of Crimea, oblasts, cities of Kyiv and Sevastopol take part in the competition
  • Questions regarding the admission of athletes or teams of Donetsk and Luhansk regions to participate in competitions,Sevastopol and Autonomous Republic of Crimea are decided by a panel of judges
  • Participants must be 18 years old on the day of the competition, and they must have a sports qualification of at least 1st grade of the ECSU
  • All participants must submit the following documents to the mandate commission
    • application letter for participation according to the prescribed form, approved by the medical and physical culture dispensary
    • an additional information application in the established form, approved by the head of the sports organization
    • passport (military identity card)
    • the membership book of the UFKKU (NFKKU) with the license stamp of the UFKKU for 2024
    • a copy of the payment order for the payment of the charitable non-refundable contribution for participation in the competition
    • voluntary insurance policy
    • identification code
  • Participants compete in sports uniforms and mandatory personal protectors in accordance with the Rules of kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine
    • For men – a groin protector is personal and mandatory.
    • For women – groin protector and shin and foot protectors (white, soft, elastic, fastening – “stocking”), chest protector (worn under a white T-shirt) are personal and mandatory.
    • All participants must provide all personal protectors for inspection and marking at the mandate committee during the weigh-in.
  • Conditions for the Great Dane:
    • dogi jackets must have the kanji emblems "shin-kyokushinkai" or "kyokushinkai" on the left side of the sternum.Emblems on the sleeves of the jacket are allowed (state flag, WKO, NFKKU, club emblems, etc.);
    • dogi pants may contain shin-kyokushinkai or kyokushinkai kanji emblems, the OSU! logo, other memorial inscriptions and emblems.
  • All other emblems, logos, inscriptions, etc. are prohibited. Therefore, they must be removed from the dog's jacket or pants or covered in advance with a tightly sewn white cloth

Categories of participants:

Adult men/women (kumite):
Age Gender Weight categories Qualifiers Semifinal/final
1990-2005 Men -60 -70 -80 -90 +90 2 min., 2 min., 2 min. 3 min., 2 min., 2 min., 2 min.
1990-2005 Women -50 -54 -59 -65 +65 2 min., 2 min., 2 min. 3 min., 2 min., 2 min., 2 min.

Adult men/women (individual kata):
Difficulty level Qualifiers from the 1/4 finals
1 Heksai-dai, Yantsu, Tsuki-no-kata, Saiha, Heksai-sho Seipai, Haryu, Seienchin, Kanku, Susi-ho
Personal choice kata in the quarter-finals, semi-finals, 3rd place match and final must be different.

Adult men/women (team kata):
Difficulty level Qualifiers from the 1/4 finals
1 Heksai-dai, Yantsu, Tsuki-no-kata, Saiha, Heksai-sho Seipai, Haryu, Seienchin, Kanku, Susi-ho
Personal choice kata in the quarter-finals, semi-finals, 3rd place match and final must be different.

Juniors/junior girls (kumite):
Age Gender Weight categories Regulations
2006-2007 Juniors -60 -65 -70 -75 -80 +80 2 min., 2 min., 2 min.
2006-2007 Junior girls -50 -55 -60 -65 +65 2 min., 2 min., 2 min.

Juniors/junior girls (individual kata):
Difficulty level Qualifiers from the 1/4 finals
2 Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu, Saiha, Heksai-sho
Personal choice kata in the quarter-finals, semi-finals, 3rd place match and final must be different.

Juniors (team kata):
Difficulty level Qualifiers from the 1/4 finals
2 Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu, Saiha, Heksai-sho
Personal choice kata in the quarter-finals, semi-finals, 3rd place match and final must be different.

Boys/girls (kumite):
Age Gender Weight categories Regulations
2008-2009 Young men -50 -55 -60 -65 -70 -75 +75 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 3 kg., 1.5 min.
2008-2009 Girls -50 -55 -60 -65 +65 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 3 kg., 1.5 min.

Competition conditions

Competitions are held in accordance with the "Kyokushinkai Karate Competition Rules" in force in Ukraine. Team scoring is common for male and female participants and is determined separately in the "kumite" and "kata" sections. To determine the places of teams based on individual and team championships, the results of only those participants who are included in the qualifying teams will be taken into account. The standings of the teams are finally determined by the mandate committee. Team points are calculated according to the rules of kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine

Financing

Expenses for the organization of the competition (awarding the winners and prize-winners, catering for the judging panel, renting sports facilities and auxiliary premises, competition headquarters and office equipment, renting tatami mats, paying for stationery, medicines, medical and service personnel, printing posters, programs and other paraphernalia for the competition, placement of advertisements, transport and other expenses for the organization of competitions) are carried out at the expense of the Lviv Regional Kyokushinkai Karate Federation, interested institutions, organizations and sponsors.

Awards

Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded diplomas of the Federation of the respective degrees and medals. Teams that took 1-3 places are awarded diplomas of the Federation of the respective degrees.

Athletes', coaches' and judges' questionnaires for the "Sports Result" computer database are attached to the application. The application letter for participation in the established form, other necessary documents and insurance poles are submitted to the mandate commission during the medical commission and weighing of the participants. Teams that have confirmed their participation within the set deadline are admitted to the competition
